meanings.definition: To make (someone) favorably inclined; appease or conciliate.
meanings.sent1: She tried to propitiate her angry friend by offering a sincere apology.
meanings.sent2: The company sent a gift basket to propitiate their dissatisfied customer.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to propitiate his grumpy cat by giving it extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The chef hoped to propitiate the food critic with a complimentary dessert.
meanings.sent5: The child brought flowers to propitiate his upset teacher.

meanings.definition: To gain or regain the favor or goodwill of.
meanings.sent1: The student worked hard to propitiate his teacher after failing the test.
meanings.sent2: The politician made promises to propitiate the voters before the election.
meanings.sent3: She baked cookies to propitiate her upset neighbor after the noisy party.
meanings.sent4: The team captain tried to propitiate the coach by showing dedication in practice.
meanings.sent5: The dog wagged its tail to propitiate its owner for chewing the shoe.
